name: Mona Lisa Overdrive
description: A seminal cyberpunk novel by William Gibson, continuing the Sprawl Trilogy with intersecting stories of hackers, corporate power, and artificial intelligence.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Mona Lisa Overdrive, published in 1988, is the third novel in William Gibson's influential Sprawl Trilogy. Set in a cyberpunk future dominated by ubiquitous cyberspace, corporate intrigue, and complex human-machine interfaces, the novel intertwines the lives of four central characters whose paths converge around a shadowy cyber underworld. Building upon the themes and settings of its predecessors, it pushes forward notions of identity, reality, and technology’s impact on society.

content.title: Plot Summary
content.body: The novel unfolds through multiple narrative threads, focusing on Mona Lisa, a high-class prostitute with ties to powerful entities; Angie Mitchell, a young girl with cybernetic enhancements granting her unprecedented sensory access to cyberspace; Bobby Newmark, a hacker trying to make a name for himself; and Slick Henry, an avant-garde artist who creates mechanical constructs from scrap. Through their intersecting stories, Mona Lisa Overdrive explores a world where technology and human consciousness collide, culminating in a high-stakes encounter involving corporate espionage and artificial intelligence.

content.title: Themes
content.body: Mona Lisa Overdrive deals deeply with cybernetic augmentation, the blurred line between human and machine, and the nature of consciousness and identity in a mediated world. It explores the consequences of corporate dominance, the fragmentation of self in a hyper-connected digital landscape, and the socio-political dynamics of power. Themes of surveillance, exploitation, and resistance permeate the narrative, inviting reflection on humanity’s technological trajectory.

content.title: Reception
content.body: Critically acclaimed for its ambitious narrative and stylistic innovation, Mona Lisa Overdrive solidified William Gibson’s status as a pioneer of the cyberpunk genre. While some critics noted its complex plot and dense prose as challenging, the novel was praised for its vivid world-building, intricate characterizations, and prescient depiction of digital culture. It remains a touchstone in speculative fiction and an early influence on cyber-culture.
